inn1.comm: flat on a good length outside off, Wade lets it go
fuller length on off stump, Wade drives towards cover where Tharanga fumbles
defended on the leg side
Wade tries to turn the ball towards leg but gets a leading edge on the off side
shot, the length was a bit short outside off, Wade went back and punched it through the gap at point
Warner strides forward and blocks
good length around off stump, Warner opens the face to play behind point and runs
good length and straight, Wade moves across his crease and defends on the leg side
a sloppy start in the field from Sri Lanka, Sangakkara fails to collect cleanly as he dives to his right after the batsman let it go. The bounce was low, though, it didn't carry to Sanga
short and wide outside off stump, Wade uses the room to hit the ball hard through cover off the back foot
Kulasekara appeals for lbw after hitting Wade on the pad but that might have pitched outside leg stump
good length outside off, Wade lets it pass
played off the back foot on the leg side
played between midwicket and square leg from deep in the crease
defended on the front foot
bowled flat and into the left-hand batsman from round the wicket, defended on the front foot
the quicker ball, Wade has to hurry and block on the back foot
pushed off the front foot towards mid-off for a single
short of a length on leg and middle, Wade turns it off his hips towards square and calls Warner through
good length on middle stump, Warner plays on the leg side without moving his feet that much
short of a length with width outside off, Warner cracks it off the back foot, but doesn't beat cover
short of a length and wide once again, Warner stays back and cuts towards third man

more sloppiness from Sri Lanka, Wade played the ball off the back foot behind point and ran an easy single, but Dilshan felt the need to throw at the stumps at the batsman's end even though Warner was well in his crease. He hit the stumps and then conceded an overthrow
defended on the off side
forced off the back foot through midwicket for a single
bowled him! Dilshan's been skidding his balls through to the batsman, and Wade tried to pull this one when it wasn't that short, he missed and Dilshan hit off stump
played off the back foot towards square leg
defended on the off side
Watson moves forward and blocks
Watson steps out, takes the ball on the full, and drives to long-on
short of a length outside off stump, Watson cuts off the back foot to point
length ball outside off stump, Watson moves forward and plays towards point
Watson pushes forward at another length ball and Dilshan fields at point, and then he throws at the bowler's end
good length and much straighter, Watson gets behind the line and defends
Watson gets on to the front foot and defends a good length ball on the off side once again
yes he can, bowls a good length ball outside off, Watson tries to force it through cover and plays from his crease. He gets a thick bottom edge into the ground and towards Sanga
Warner strides forward and defends towards cover
played towards long off for a single
width outside off stump, Watson waits and cuts late, sending the ball speeding towards the third man boundary, Malinga chases and pulls it back in just before the rope
Warner goes back and cuts the ball from in front of his stumps to the fielder at point
punched towards mid off but Dilshan dives to his right to make the save
Warner moves back and across and plays towards square leg
short of a length outside off, Watson opens the face to steer towards third man, the fielder at a wide slip dives to his right and makes a half stop
Warner stays in his crease and punches the ball hard towards cover, can't beat the infield
good length on middle stump, Warner stays in his crease and defends towards point
Warner stays on the back foot and defends a good length delivery towards the off, Malinga is skidding them through on middle stump
that was a slower ball and Warner had to wait to play it. He pushed it back to the bowler, he was trying to hit through the off side
defended back to the bowler once again
good length outside off stump, Watson strides forward and defends
the length is good but the line is outside off, Watson cuts towards third man where a fumble from Malinga allows the second
fuller length but the line is outside off once again, allowing Watson to cut towards third man
Watson cuts, but this time to Dilshan at point
played off the pads on the front foot towards square leg
Warner stays back to a fuller ball and pushes towards mid-on for a single
good length and straight, played on the off side from the crease
pushed back to the bowler on the back foot
that's in the air but it's cleared the fielder! Maharoof bowled a full, slower ball and Warner got on the front foot and spooned the drive flat over the head of the leaping fielder at extra cover
played towards mid on for a single
pushed off the back foot towards cover
another slower ball, Watson defends on the front foot towards the off side
pushed towards the fielder at short midwicket

Warner strides forward and drives towards long-off, and what have Sri Lanka done? Another overthrow. Kulasekara threw on the half-volley to Sanga, who didn't collect because of awkward bounce, and there was no one backing up
driven through cover for a single
played off the pads towards square leg
pushed off the back foot towards long off
Warner goes back and cuts from off stump towards deep point
good length on middle and off, Warner stays in his crease and defends towards the leg side
Warner's spooned another drive over the head of the fielder at extra cover, this time the fielder at mid-off runs to his right to field the ball
short of a length and straight, Watson gets behind the line and blocks
tight line and length from Maharoof, around off stump, Watson defends on the front foot

dropped, Sri Lanka's shoddy fielding continues. Watson cut the ball hard off the front foot but it flew straight to Dilshan at point at a comfortable height. He got both hands to it but couldn't hold on. By Dilshan's standards, that's a sitter. He was moving towards his left and seemed to be off balance as the ball hit his hand
Watson mis-times the off-drive against a good length ball
played off the back foot on the leg side
played back to the bowler
driven off the front foot to long off
Warner tries to drive a flighted ball and gets an inside edge on to the pad
Warner drives firmly and straight, Dilshan dives to his left to save runs
driven on the front foot through cover
Warner plays the front-foot drive and hits the length ball through cover
Watson tries to defend from his crease but the ball bounces a bit more and takes the inside edge past the stumps
defended on the off side, that was a slower ball
short of a length outside off stump, Watson throws his bat at it, aiming to hit the ball through point. The ball came slowly off the surface and beat the bat

dropped again, by Herath at long-off. The fielder had been pushed back to long-off, and Watson played the lofted drive. Herath once again mis-judged the catch by running in too far, he then had to back pedal to get under it. In the previous game he managed to take a blinder off Wade after an initial misjudgment, this time he stretches out one hand and drops it as the ball falls behind his head. Watson's been let off twice.
Watson pulls but gets an inside edge on to the body
defended on the off side
driven through cover for a single
played down the ground for one
defended on the off side
played off the pads behind square
Watson forces the ball towards midwicket

Watson's been run out! He dived full length into the crease but has still been caught short by Maharoof's direct hit. Dilshan and Herath will be very relieved men, after they both dropped Watson. Warner pushed the ball on the leg side and ran a quick single, Maharoof sprinted to his left, picked up, turned around, and threw at the batsman's end. He could have attempted to run out Warner as well, but decided Watson had had enough let-offs. A badly judged run. Watson was watching the ball and I don't think he expected Maharoof to throw at his end because the bowler had to turn around and transfer the ball from left to right hand
defended on the off side from the crease
Clarke gets an inside edge towards fine leg for a single
played through midwicket for one more
defended on the front foot towards cover
length ball outside off, Clarke plays it towards point
pushed off the back foot towards cover point, that was good length and straight
good length but the line is on the pads, Warner plays it through square
Clarke strides a long way out of his crease and defends back to the bowler
Clarke strides on to the front foot and drives to cover point
the slower ball at 104kph on middle stump, played off the pads towards square
played back to the bowler on the front foot
length ball on middle and leg, Clarke nudges the ball off his pads through square
Warner drives a slower ball from his crease towards long off
Clarke drives a full delivery firmly off the front foot but Mahela dives to his right at mid-off to stop the ball, saved three runs
played off the back foot towards cover

Warner's smashed it! He wound up and swung hard at a length ball on the front foot, clearing the wide long-on boundary comfortably. That's a long boundary at Adelaide Oval and Warner hit the ball into the stands. That was measured at 99 metres. A monster of a hit.
played off the pads towards midwicket
Warner goes on the back foot and taps the ball towards cover
Clarke gets on to the front foot by taking two steps out and then drives into the gap on the deep cover boundary
defended on the leg side
Warner moves back and across and plays the ball through square leg
a loud appeal for lbw after Clarke misses the pull. The ball was slower and Clarke moved across his stumps to play the shot. The impact was a bit high, on the box
that's too full and down leg side
Clarke strides forward and drives to mid-off, fluent shot, Clarke's moving nicely in his crease, coming forward to cope with the slowness of the pitch
good length and straight, defended back to the bowler
Clarke drives straight, Malinga tries to field but gets only finger tips on the ball
Clarke cuts hard off the front foot but Dilshan dives to his left to save runs
short of a length outside off, Clarke plays off the back foot towards point

short of a length outside off, Clarke taps it into the gap in front of point and runs, Dilshan picks up and throws at the bowler's end. He misses but I think Clarke was safe even if there was a direct hit
Malinga ends the bowling Powerplay with a loose full toss outside off, Warner stays in his crease and hits it through the gap at cover
nudged towards midwicket on the front foot
Clarke comes forward and drives to long-on
Warner pushes off the front foot towards point
Warner gets forward and plays to backward point again
Warner tries to drive one that slants across him and is beaten
driven firmly back to the bowler, Herath slips a little as he fields, and is a little slow in getting to his feet
Dilshan returns and gets an outside edge from Clarke, as the batsman was trying to play on the leg side, the ball went towards third man
bowled slowly to Warner, who plays from the crease on the leg side
tossed up into the left-hander, Warner drives towards long-on
Clarke once again gets a thick outside edge on the off side, he was looking to play straight
Warner steps forward and drives back to the bowler
tossed up with width outside off, Warner reaches out and drives through cover
bowled flat outside off stump, Warner stays in his crease and punches to long off
Clarke moves across his crease to a fuller ball and works it off his pads behind square
Warner drives the ball towards long off, Herath tries to intercept but it's too far away from him
Clarke steps out of his crease to take the ball as it pitches and plays through midwicket
Warner stays in his crease and plays through cover point, five singles in five balls
Sangakkara appeals for lbw after Clarke skips out of his crease to whip through midwicket and misses. He was a long, long way out of his crease
Warner moves back and across and works the single through midwicket
Clarke plays the ball behind point and runs two to third man
played back to the bowler
Clarke goes back and plays the ball off his pads through midwicket
Warner stays in his crease and cuts to Malinga at backward point
Warner retains strike by punching through the off side
full ball on leg and middle, Warner brings up Australia's 100 with a drive to long on
Clarke steps out of his crease and drives to long-off
Warner strides out and drives along the ground to long-off
full ball on the pads, Clarke clips it around the corner
defended on the front foot, Herath strides to his right and fields
Warner waits for a flighted ball and drives on the front foot towards mid-off
cut off the back foot towards cover point, he reaches his half-century. A more sedate and composed one today, after that aggressive century at the Gabba. Valuable nonetheless on this slow surface.
Clarke steps out, gets to the pitch of the ball, and drives to long off to bring up the 50 partnership
quicker ball on off and middle, defended from the crease
punched off the back foot towards extra cover

that's full and on the pads, Warner turns if behind square and there's more silliness from Sri Lanka in the field. Sangakkara was chasing the ball, and Kulasekara was running in from the deep and there was a small collision between the two. Wonder how Jayawardene's blood pressure is today.
defended towards cover
Clarke steps out of his crease and plays to midwicket
Clarke steps out to turn towards square and gets hit on the pad
Clarke steps out again and makes contact this time, playing the ball off his pads towards long leg
Clarke comes out of his crease, gets to the pitch of the ball, and clips through midwicket
Warner leans towards the off from his crease and plays to midwicket
Warner plays to midwicket again, and this time he places it wide of the diving fielder
good length and straight, defended on the off side
Warner stays in his crease and pushes the ball towards long on
Clarke steps out to a length ball and punches past the bowler towards long on
full length and straight, Warner comes forward and drives, Kulasekara moves to his left to field
short of a length angling across the left-hander, Warner plays from his crease, hitting the ball uppishly through cover point
short ball, and Clarke is quick while playing the short-arm pull, lofting it into the gap on the deep square boundary
Warner stays in his crease and pushes the ball to midwicket
fuller ball on leg stump, Warner plays towards long on for a single
Clarke takes two steps out and turns the ball off his pads behind square
a loud appeal for lbw after Warner stays in his crease and misses the turn to square leg, that pitched outside leg stump
played from the crease towards extra cover
tossed up on middle stump, Clarke uses the angle into him to push the ball through midwicket off the front foot
played off the front foot towards wide long on
length ball angling across Warner, he slogs across the line and mis-hits the ball behind square, he was aiming more towards midwicket
driven off the front foot towards point
Warner plays a forceful shot towards point where Kapugedara dives to his left and saves runs
punched towards mid-on from the crease
a full toss on off stump, Warner drives to long off for a single
full ball on middle stump, Warner clips the ball towards wide long on
played off the pads through midwicket for a single
played back to the bowler from the crease
pushed towards Kapugedera at extra cover
short of a length with width outside off, cut off the back foot through point
that's down leg side and a wide
Clarke plays off the front foot towards long-on
full ball outside off stump from over the wicket, Clarke steps out and drives through midwicket, they run two before the fielder from long on can prevent it
pushed through midwicket once again
full and straight from Malinga, Warner stays in his crease and plays towards midwicket
length ball on the pads, Clarke misses the glance and runs a leg bye towards square leg
that's too far down leg side, a rubbish line with fine leg in the circle, Warner moves across his stumps and glances past the fielder to collect four
length ball around off stump, Warner pushes from his crease towards mid-off to score the 10th run off the first batting Powerplay over
a full delivery outside off stump, driven firmly but straight to cover
short of a length angling across the left-hand batsman, Warner stays in his crease and punches through the gap at cover

a slower ball, which Warner drives to mid-off and challenges the fielder. He beats the throw at the bowler's end, the fielder missed anyway. Warner hobbled a little after completing that run, probably a little sore after that groin injury
played off the pads towards deep square leg
a length ball outside off, it was the slower one but Warner had room to drive, and drive he did, hitting hit hard through the gap at cover, there's no fielder in the deep
in the blockhole this time, Warner digs it out towards mid-off for a single
in the air, but safe! Warner tries to pull a short ball but gets a top edge that falls short and wide of the fielder at mid-on
good length around off stump, Clarke stays in his crease and blocks
the length's not bad on off stump, Clarke moves forward and a little across to drive the ball towards long-on

shoddy work from Malinga, Warner played the ball back to the bowler and Malinga failed to stop it cleanly, he reacted as though he got a touch on the ball before it very close to the stumps at the non-striker's end, with Clarke out of his crease. He should have fielded it cleanly in the first place
defended on the off side
Clarke whips the ball off his pads towards deep midwicket
a straight full toss, Warner drives to long off and calls for two, he won't get the second
a full ball on middle and leg, Clarke moves forward and towards the off side, taking the ball on the full and flicking it into the gap on the backward square leg boundary
another full ball on the pads, Clarke clips it along the ground to deep square leg

Clarke gets to his half-century by tapping a length ball off his pads towards fine leg, a horrible line from Kulasekara in this over. Clarke's adjusted beautifully to the slowness of this surface, he assessed it in no time at all.
hit down the ground to long off for a single
Clarke drives off the front foot towards long on
a length ball around off, Clarke moves across and pulls the ball flat towards deep square leg
driven off the front foot towards cover
Warner jumps back and taps the ball towards the off side
Malinga gets the ball to lift off a good length and move across Warner, who stayed in his crease and tried to waft, he was beaten
played off the back foot towards cover

Warner gets a bit of a leading edge as he was trying to turn the ball towards square, Malinga runs to his right to pick up the ball. Malinga began the batting Powerplay by conceding 10 in an over, he's ended it by conceding one. Australia scored 37 in the five-over block
tight line and Clarke plays it straight back
goes down the track and flicks him to the leg side
Warner uses his feet too and gets a single to long-on
plays from the crease to square leg
Warner tucks it to square leg, the batsmen think about the single but after already being involved in a run out Warner calls no
played to long-on
short of a length outside off, Warner steers the ball towards point where Dilshan dives to his left and makes the save
a slower ball on leg and middle, that looked like the off cutter, Warner moves back and turns the ball through square
Clarke moves forward and across to force the ball through square leg with a controlled pull
a full ball on off stump, Warner drives towards long off for a single
Clarke moves forward and across and swings his bat across his front pad, hitting the ball from off stump behind square
Warner pushes forward and tries to drive, he gets a thick outside edge that goes behind point
Warner leans forward and drives the ball to cover
Warner goes back and tries to force the ball through midwicket, it keeps a bit low and he gets an inside edge on to the pad
driven to long off for one more
Clarke steps out of his crease and plays through midwicket
a flat ball on the stumps, Warner stays back and forces it towards long on
Clarke turns the ball off his pads behind square
Clarke moves forward and tries to swing across the line, he gets an inside edge on to the body
a full ball in the blockhole, Warner digs it out towards the off side

Sangakkara throws the ball up in the air in celebration and Maharoof appeals confidently, but the umpire is unmoved. Warner tried to squeeze a full ball through the off side and was beaten. I think the bat hit the ground there, and missed the ball completely
played off the back foot through the off side
Clarke's been trying to do this for a while now, moving forward and towards the off just a little, to create room to whip the ball off his hips to the long leg boundary
full ball on the pads, flicked through midwicket for a single
Herath bowls one into the blockhole, Clarke digs it out on the off side
shot! Clarke reaches forward, gets down on one knee and swings hard, slog-sweeping a short ball over the deep square leg boundary

another drop, the Sri Lankan fielding nightmare continues. Clarke goes inside out and lofts the ball over extra cover, Kulasekara runs to his left from long off and has to catch it on the move, he gets two hands to it but drops it as he falls to the turf
whipped off the pads to deep midwicket
played down the ground for a single
he tried to play it on the leg side but got a leading edge towards point
a full ball on off stump, driven from the crease towards point
a full toss outside off stump, Warner drives from his crease through cover to move into the 90s, Australia pass 200 as well
full and straight, driven to long on from the crease
Clarke tries to move across the crease and let the ball go as it angles into him, he misjudged the line and was hit on the pad

a full ball swinging into the right-hander, Clarke drives towards mid-off, the fielder from extra cover runs to his right but fails to reach the ball, he might have blinded the fielder at mid-off though, who fumbled to allow the single. Sri Lanka have been absent minded in the field today, woozy thinking
a full ball outside off, driven through cover
in the blockhole outside off stump, Clarke plays on the off side
Clarke makes room by moving towards leg and drives the ball fluently along the ground to deep cover, the partnership is now 150
a low full toss on off stump, Warner guides the ball towards third man
Clarke moves forward and across to work a full ball through midwicket
in the blockhole outside off stump, Warner plays it towards point
a full ball around off stump, Warner drives towards extra cover and runs
a full toss outside off stump, Warner drives from the crease in front of point

dropped on the square leg boundary, Clarke pulls the short ball in the air towards Malinga, who was in an awful position to take the catch. He lunged towards his right and behind his body, and palmed the ball over the rope. Jayawardene replaces Malinga with Dilshan in that position
whipped forcefully off the pads to the long leg boundary, Clarke might beat Warner to the century at this rate!
Clarke goes down the ground, lofting a length ball cleanly over the straight boundary, Jayawardene looks a bit helpless in the field

a high full toss and Clarke hammers the pull to the square leg boundary, hitting it flat with a lot of power. The umpire signals six but Dilshan indicates it's a four. It bounced just inside the boundary. Mahela is having an animated discussion with both umpires about a no-ball call, it's a very delayed call by the umpire. It's possibly a no-ball for height. Mahela is very unhappy and visibly so
worked of the pads behind square for a single
played on the off side
Clarke moves to 99 by playing the ball towards deep midwicket
played towards point and straight to the fielder
Warner cuts once again but can't beat point
a full toss and Warner hits it past the bowler, Chandimal is quick to reach the ball from long-on and prevents the second

a full ball on the pads, Clarke clips it through square to reach a phenomenal hundred. This pitch has not been easy to score on, the ball has come slowly on to the bat, but Clarke has reached his 100 off 81 balls. A superlative display of footwork
Warner moves to 99 by cutting through point

Warner drives a full ball through cover to reach his century, his second consecutive one in the CB Series finals. A different innings to the one at the Gabba, he's toiled for this one, and put Australia on course for a large score
Clarke slices the ball past in the air and over Thirimanne at point, he got finger tips on the ball as he jumped up
a full ball swinging towards the stumps, dug out on the leg side
an appeal for a catch behind after Warner gets beaten by a full ball in the blockhole, another case of Warner's bat hitting ground

they've caught one in the deep! Dilshan was the man on the deep cover boundary and he came running in and slid to catch Warner's lofted drive. It's been an uncharacteristic innings from Warner, who had a groin injury after the first final. I wonder if he'll come out to field. Well played though, he had to tailor his game to the demands of a slower surface.
Malinga lands the yorker just outside off stump, Hussey gets beaten as he plays from the crease

what a shot that is, Clarke began to try and paddle the ball to fine leg, and then opened the face to reverse paddle the full toss through third man. He assumed it was going for four though and didn't run initially, Malinga gave chase and pulled it in, sloppy cricket from Clarke after a superb hundred
Hussey plays the reverse paddle this time and places it past the fielder at short third man, he's timed it well enough to reach the boundary
played on the off side for a single
tremendous batting, tremendous. Clarke lines up Herath and slams him over the midwicket boundary with a massive swing of the bat on the front foot
played through point for a single
Hussey works a full toss off his pads in front of square leg
bowled him! Hussey comes out of his crease and towards the leg side, trying to drive through the off. Malinga beats him with a full and fast ball and hits the stumps
one in the blockhole on off stump, Hussey tries to squeeze it out on the off side and gets an inside edge on the leg
Clarke stays in his crease and lofts a full ball on the bounce to long-on
a full ball outside off, played towards point
another yorker from Malinga, Hussey manages to play it towards mid-off
Clarke moves forward and outside off before opening the face to steer a full ball towards backward point
Clarke waits in his crease and drills a full ball through midwicket
a full toss and Hussey lofts it towards wide long-on
in the blockhole, Hussey makes room by moving towards leg and slogs towards long on
a full ball on off and middle stump, Clarke makes room and drives to long off
dropped again, how many today? Hussey backward away and swung a length ball straight to Herath at midwicket, that was an absolute sitter, shocking fielding from Herath

and after that bit of sloppiness, Herath produces a direct hit to run out Clarke. Clarke played the ball straight to the fielder at midwicket and set off, he's in discomfort as he runs though and doesn't dive to try and make his crease. Herath's throw has him well short. Clarke's played a terrific innings but is in pain as he walks off, looks like an issue with his leg
a full ball outside off, the batsman tries to paddle on the leg side and gets beaten
in the blockhole, the batsman swings and gets an inside edge towards square leg
a low full toss, Hussey swings across the line and gets an inside edge into the ground near his boot
a full ball bowled wide outside off stump, Christian throws his bat at it and slices the ball towards Herath at third man
Malinga finds the blockhole again, Christian plays it towards midwicket
bowled him, Malinga lands another perfect yorker and beats Hussey's slog with the swing into the right-hander, the ball clips leg stump

inn2.comm: length ball on the pads, Mahela plays the glance from his crease towards fine leg
short and wide outside off stump, Dilshan has a real go at it, flaying his bat hard and carving the ball flat and fast to the point boundary
Dilshan moves forward and plays the ball back to the bowler
Lee gets the ball to swing but the line was extremely wide outside off, Dilshan tries to lay into this one as well but can't connect
much straighter and in the blockhole, Lee's getting the ball to shape away from the right-hander, Dilshan digs it out
tight line and length close to off stump, Dilshan begins to poke but then pulls his bat away from the ball
Lee sprays it down leg side this time ... bowling to the left, bowling to the right ...
another wide ball down leg side, this is a long opening over

what's happened there? Lee's beaten the bat with a short of a length ball outside off, Dilshan tried to flay it through the offside but missed. The ball swung sharply towards the right after passing the bat and beat Wade's dive to the left
short of a length outside off, Jayawardene steers off the back foot towards third man
length ball angling into the right-hander, Dilshan clips it off his pads through square leg

caught behind! But the umpire is checking to see if it's a front-foot no-ball. It is, McKay had overstepped. It was a wide ball outside off and Mahela slashed at it, reaching far away from his body. He got a thick edge through to the keeper. The Australians began to celebrate but the umpire Bruce Oxenford wanted the no-ball checked immediately. Free-hit coming up ...
the free-hit is a slower ball outside off, Jayawardene heaves at it and is beaten
steered towards third man for a single
Dilshan reaches for a short of a length delivery outside off and hits it with the bottom of the bat past the diving fielder at short cover, that was in the air but just out of reach
defended on the front foot on the off side
edged and four! The ball was full outside off with swing away from the right-hander, Dilshan pushed at it from the crease and edged it wide of the fielder at first slip
whoa, that's sprayed far down leg side, massive swing past the right-hander and Wade does superbly to dive to his left and get some glove on it
Pattinson beats Dilshan's drive with a lovely outswinger on a good length
a huge roar of an appeal for lbw after Dilshan misses the hoick towards square leg, he was right in front of the stumps but height was an issue
played from the crease towards cover

edged again for four! Dilshan goes after a full ball outside off, aiming for cover point, he gets a thick outside edge that flies wide of David Hussey at second slip. Pattinson is getting the ball to swing away from Dilshan
cut hard off the back foot but Warner makes the save at point
good length outside off stump, Mahela moves forward and punches towards mid-off
Mahela charges McKay and mis-times the pull towards midwicket, the length wasn't short enough
fuller length on middle stump, nudged off the pads from the crease towards square leg
played to the fielder at point
Dilshan drives a length ball towards mid-off
short of a length outside off stump, cut off the back foot towards Warner at point
full length on off stump with some movement away from Mahela, who stays in his crease and plays towards midwicket
Pattinson's overstepped, Dilshan pushed at a length ball outside off and was beaten, quite a big no-ball as well
the free-hit is a slower full toss and Dilshan mis-hits the swat towards square leg, the ball goes close on the leg side
shot! Mahela steps out of his crease to the pace of Pattinson and drills a full ball hard past the bowler to the straight boundary, the ball deflected off the bowler
short this time and Mahela sends the ball flat to the square leg boundary with a swivel pull from the crease, one-bounce four
played from the crease on the leg side
short of a length ball outside off, Mahela dabs it towards slips but doesn't run this time, I think he was run out at the MCG like that
played to the fielder at short cover
a full ball outside off, Dilshan drives towards cover from his crease and finds the gap, David Hussey chases and reaches the ball in the nick of time

the Dilscoop or the Starfish? Dilshan got down low and tried to scoop a length ball over his head, fine leg was in the circle. He missed and the ball smacked into his helmet. Dilshan's called for a new helmet.
Mahela laced the cover drive off the front foot with superb timing but David Hussey leaped to his left at cover to save three runs
well Dilshan's tried it again and with success this time. He moves towards the off and scoops the ball past the fielder at short fine leg. He didn't get down as low this time
he's tried to scoop it again, this time from outside off stump, Dilshan was aiming to hit it towards the keeper's right and was beaten this time. It's quite manic, the cricket at the moment
flat ball fired in at the stumps, Jayawardene cuts towards point
bowled slower towards middle stump, played towards square leg on the front foot
width outside off stump, Mahela waits and dabs the ball late towards third man, Warner chases from point
played back to the bowler on the front foot
pushed off the front foot towards the bowler's right, both batsmen begin to run and then stop, they run again and stop again
played along the ground through midwicket for two more
a loopy slow ball out of the back of the hand outside off stump, Mahela mis-times the drive, he was early on the shot
this is quicker and skids through on Mahela, he tries to dab from the crease and inside edges past his stumps to the keeper
a full ball outside off, Mahela strides forward and drives but Christian dives to his left at cover to save the boundary
a length ball outside off stump, hit hard off the back foot to cover, the fielder throws at the bowler's end but misses the stumps, there is back up
played from the crease towards point
another slower ball outside off stump, Dilshan steers it behind point for a single
Australia are sloppy in the field now, Warner let a cut go straight through him at point, he couldn't bend properly, perhaps because of his groin?
played towards square leg
cut from the crease towards point, Warner fields cleanly this time
driven to long off for a single
Mahela moves forward and drives to the fielder at short cover
he steps out of his crease and sends the ball over the fielder at mid-on with a full swing of the bat

short and wide outside off, Dilshan has room to swing his arms and he does so with power, cutting the ball in the air but behind the fielder at point, he's placed it square enough to beat third man as well
Dilshan stays in his crease and drives a full ball towards wide mid-on
a slower ball outside off stump, Mahela waits for it and steers towards third man
another slower ball, Dilshan tries to turn the ball towards the leg side but gets hit on the thigh for a leg bye on the off side
Mahela opens the face and steers the ball from outside off stump towards third man
Dilshan strides forward and drives to Watson at mid-off
angled into leg stump and goes off Mahela's pad to square leg. Missed opportunity for Mahela. That was a boundary ball
better line, in the corridor outside off and Dilshan steers it to third man
again outside off and Mahela opens the face and plays it to third man
yorker from Lee and Dilshan squeezes it out to mid-on. Pattinson rushes in but the batsnam steal a quick single
on the stumps and Mahela flicks it elegantly to deep square leg
looks for the yorker again but its a low full toss this time and Dilshan drives it to mid-off
starts with a ball on a good line outside off, which is steered fine on the off side
this one is on the stumps and Dilshan defends
beats the bat outside off. Dilshan beaten by lack of pace more than movement
dicey-looking late cut from Dilshan. That shot entails a lot of risk for just one run
on off stump and Mahela pushes it to mid-on for a quick single
on off stump and Dilshan opens the face but cannot beat point
full on of stump, Mahela drives hard but it's well fielded by Christian at short cover. Nice-looking shot for no runs
shortens the length and Mahela steers to third man again. Sri Lanka really peppering that area
short ball from Lee, Dilshan thinks about the hook but sways away at the last minute. It was outside off so goes harmlessly through to Wade
slower ball and Dilshan had to make a late adjustment. Deals with it in the end and pushes to point
full again, perhaps searching for the yorker, Dilshan drives it to deep cover point
good length on off and again Mahela looks for the steer to third man, but gets it too square and point cuts it off
a bit of width and Dilshan has a slash but doesn't time it and just gets one to deep cover point
Mahela goes down the track and slaps it to the leg side. Was not in full control and it was in the air, but it beats short midwicket and goes for four
and now he reverts to the steer to third man for a single
and Dilshan repeats the shot. Had to bend down quite low to play it
for the umpteenth time, Mahela guides the ball to third man
this time the steer on the off side goes a bit squarer and the batsmen run two as third man has to run to his right
short of a length and quick outside off, Jayawardene gets beaten while trying to steer towards third man, he walks away to the leg side and berates himself
cut off the back foot towards point
that's half steered, half outside-edged to the third man boundary, Lee bowled it on a good length outside off, giving Jayawardene some width
a full ball on off stump, Jayawardene drives towards mid-off
short of a length at the body, Jayawardene dabs it close on the off side and wants one, Dilshan does not
banged in short, Jayawardene takes cover by ducking
dabbed off the pads through square leg, the fielder needs to run in from the deep so they can take two, Sri Lanka reach 100 in quick time
cut from the crease towards backward point
cut again, a little more forcefully this time through the gap at point
Jayawardene moves across and works the straight ball off his pads behind square
that's wide outside off stump, Dilshan cuts again, in front of point, and Pattinson has some running to do on the boundary
Dilshan waits in his crease and cuts once again, and there's a mis-field at point
Jayawardene leans forward and across to paddle the ball towards fine leg
Jayawardene cuts the ball late and places it behind point, taking on Lee in the deep and completing the second
dabbed from the crease towards point
played off the front foot towards point for a single, pushed it with soft hands
driven off the front foot past the diving Hussey towards long-on, Dilshan celebrates a half-century, Jayawardene goes up to shake his hand and pats his helmet
fired down leg side, much quicker from Hussey
driven off the front foot to long off for one more
Jayawardene plays from the crease towards mid-on for a single
Dilshan gets beaten outside off while trying to late cut, Wade doesn't collect cleanly
defended back towards the bowler
played from the crease towards point
a quicker ball on middle stump, turned off the pads behind square
driven off the back foot through cover point
good length and very straight, driven from the crease towards extra cover
played back to the bowler on the front foot, Watson will keep it very straight
Dilshan charges Watson's length ball and hammers it between the bowler and mid-off, he hit that with tremendous power and with a full swing of the bat
good length delivery angling into off stump, Dilshan plays from his crease and hits the ball in front of point
Jayawardene reaches his half-century with a dab towards third man, he raises his bat to his team-mates
Dilshan charges and slogs across the line but gets beaten by a short of a length delivery
Jayawardene moves towards the off side, gets down on one knee, and creates the room to swing the ball behind square with a powerful sweep
pushed on the off side for a single
that ball skidded on to Dilshan and it was a bit too full to cut, he hit it from in front of off and middle stump
played towards midwicket for a single
driven back to the bowler and Doherty throws it back at the keeper, a rather rash throw
Dilshan goes back and cuts, placing the ball through the small gap between two fielders at point
Jayawardene jumps out of his crease to drive a full ball through cover point
full and straight, Dilshan drives from his crease towards mid-on
Jayawardene takes one hand off the bat as he swings at a length ball, lobbing it over the infield at midwicket but well short of the fielder in the deep
Dilshan gets hit on the pad as he tries to turn the ball towards square leg
pushed with soft hands in front of point for a quick single, this is the highest opening stand of the series
short of a length outside off stump, dabbed off the back foot towards third man
this is some shot! Jayawardene moves towards the off side, gets down on one knee, and sweeps the ball flat over the deep backward square leg boundary
short and wide outside off stump, cut hard towards the backward point boundary where Pattinson makes a diving save, poor running from Dilshan, he assumed it was four
driven off the front foot through extra cover
Jayawardene dabs the ball towards third man
played off the back foot through square leg, Sri Lanka reach 150 far quicker than expected
played off the pads towards midwicket, where the fielder fumbles but not very badly
Dilshan charges Watson again and swings hard at a length ball, getting a thick outside edge wide of the wicketkeeper to the third man boundary
played from the crease towards point
that's a bit too close to cut but Dilshan tries to anyway and is beaten
played of the back foot towards point
width offered outside off stump, cut late towards third man
defended on the off side
Dilshan cuts but can't beat point, Wade is standing up to the stumps
full and straight, on off stump, driven firmly to the fielder at cover
that's quite a full ball but Dilshan cuts it past point towards third man
full ball, the line is quite straight, Jayawadene lines it up and swings hard, lofting the ball flat over the fielder at mid-on
short of a length around off stump, Jayawardene defends on the back foot
a full toss on middle stump, Jayawardene drives wide of mid-on, the fielder scampers to his right and dives full length to save runs
Jayawardene moves forward and drives through cover
defended back to the bowler
Dilshan's blazed that through cover, hitting it from the crease with a lot of power, the length was on the shorter side and the line was outside off

a huge appeal for a caught behind, I heard an edge there, I thought? There was a huge edge, a massive deflection off the cut and Wade did superbly to catch it standing up to the stumps. Asad Rauf didn't see it
driven towards cover from the crease
a length ball outside off and Dilshan dabs it fine past the keeper, Doherty dives on the third man boundary to save runs, they've done a lot of that today
a full ball on the pads, Wade dives to his left to collect
full delivery outside off, driven from the crease towards deep cover
defended towards the leg side from the crease
Jayawardene edges the attempted cut, but it's a bottom edge so the ball dies and bounces well in front of the wicketkeeper
he was trying to drive on the off side but the ball goes towards midwicket
short of a length outside off, played towards the off side on the back foot
short ball, hit flat and with power towards the fielder on the deep midwicket boundary
Jayawardene launches a length ball into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on, he was on the front foot and made contact with a full swing of the bat
defended towards point from the crease
good length and straight, Jayawardene stays in his crease and defends
cut off the back foot towards the fielder on the sweeper boundary
Dilshan opens the face late to play towards third man
driven off the front foot through cover

lbw! Pattinson has trapped Jayawardene in front with a delivery that nipped in from a good length. The batsman stayed in his crease and tried to force the ball on the leg side, he was hit plumb in front on the back leg
punched off the middle of the bat to mid-off
driven off the front foot towards mid-on
good length and straight, Sangakkara stays in his crease and defends
Sangakkara tries to drive through the off side but gets an inside edge towards the bowler
defended from the crease towards cover
driven off the front foot through cover
Sangakkara strides forward and drives to cover
he steps out this time and drives towards long-on
Dilshan reaches out on the front foot and defends to cover
Dilshan steps out and pushes towards long-on
Sanga moves towards the off side and nudges the ball off his pads behind square
played towards the fielder on the deep point boundary
Pattinson pitches on a good length and brings the ball into the right-hander, Dilshan defends back to the bowler
Dilshan steers towards third man and gets a thick-ish edge, Doherty runs to his left and fields
played off the back foot towards point
Dilshan stays in his crease and plays towards midwicket
short of a length down leg side, Wade leaps to his left and saves four runs with a one-gloved take
worked off the pads through square leg
played through midwicket for one more
Sanga moves forward and across to nudge towards midwicket
Sanga steps out and forces the ball through midwicket, they wait a moment until the ball beats the diving fielder and then continue running
dabbed on the front foot towards point, "love it, love it" says Wade. not sure what he's referring to
nudged off the pads on the front foot on the leg side
Sanga whips the ball off his pads through square leg
Sangakkara moves across his stumps and flicks the ball off his pads through square
Dilshan stays on the back foot and opens the face to steer a short of a length ball towards third man
Sanga strides forward and drives towards extra cover, he wanted a run but was sent back by Dilshan, the throw at the keeper's end is a needless one and it concedes an overthrow
played off the pads through square leg, it's all rather tepid out there at the moment
Sangakkara moves across and work a short of a length ball towards the fielder at square leg
driven from the crease towards mid-off
driven off the front foot to long-on
played to long-on once again, by the left-hand batsman this time
Dilshan cuts into the gap at point
driven low and in the air towards short cover, but falls well short of the fielder
played towards midwicket
Sanga goes deep into his crease and nudges towards midwicket
what happened there? It was the slower ball and it kicked off the pitch at Dilshan, who tried to close the face too early. He got an edge off the shoulder of the bat into his neck
driven with power towards cover
Dilshan glances the ball off his pads towards fine leg, giving Watson some work to do
pushed off the front foot towards cover point
worked off the pads behind square leg, the ball's been placed into the gap so the two is on
cut off the back foot towards point
defended off the front foot on the off side, Doherty ambles across to field

pulled with power to the square leg boundary, Hussey slides and saves the four, Dilshan thinks he's got his century, but he's on 98, he's taken his helmet off and raised his bat, even Sanga went up and congratulated him, I think the scoreboard says he's on 100
cut off the back foot to point
Dilshan inside edges past his stumps, he was trying to cut but the ball went to fine leg, he gets his century now, but he's already celebrated. No reaction this time from him. That's quite funny
defended on the front foot
Dilshan cuts and beats the fielder at point and collects four more, and it's time for the batting Powerplay
Sanga tries to drive straight but gets an edge towards point
Sanga drives the full ball straight past McKay, who takes some pace off the ball, the fielders at mid-on and mid-off converge on the ball and both miss it
a short of a length slower ball outside off, Sanga mis-hits it on the off side
Dilshan nudges the slower ball off the back foot close to the keeper and sets off for the single
Sanga plays an elegant drive to mid-on for a single
Dilshan charges but gets beaten by a sower ball outside off stump, he didn't even play a shot
full ball around off stump, Sanga moves forward and drives towards cover
Sangakkara pushes at a length ball from his crease and gets an inside edge on to his body, the ball drops near his feet and Lee runs to it quickly
a bit too straight from Lee, Sangakkara stays back and glances the ball towards long leg
defended back to the bowler
Sangakkara works the ball off his pads to the fielder at fine leg
too full on the pads, Sangakkara helps it along to the fine leg boundary by glancing past the fielder in the circle
the slower ball kicks off the pitch again and gives Dilshan some trouble as he tries to play on the leg side, he took his right hand of the bat and shook it

a huge appeal for lbw after another slower ball beats Dilshan's attempt at glancing towards midwicket, that hit him on the back pad and is very close, that looked out, McKay looks gutted at the umpire's not-out decision
Dilshan once again takes his right hand off the bat as he glances behind square, it was another slower ball
Sangakkara rocks back and brings up the 50 partnership with a fierce pull to the deep midwicket boundary, he hit that from outside off stump
played off the back foot towards point
Sangakkara charges McKay and throws his bat at a short of a length delivery, carving it over the infield at point towards the vacant boundary
Dilshan stays in his crease and drives to extra cover

caught at deep midwicket. Dilshan latched on to a short ball and pulled it off the front foot, hitting it hard and flat but straight to Michael Hussey on the boundary. The crowd gives Dilshan warm applause as he walks back to the dressing room
Lee delivers a superb yorker first up, swinging into the right-hander, Chandimal is up for it though and defends confidently
this time he tries to cut a ball that is too close to him and rather quick, he gets beaten outside off stump
Chandimal stays in his crease and defends a length ball on the off side
Chandimal moves forward and drives to cover, Lee bowls a wicket maiden during the batting Powerplay
Sangakkara moves forward and across, using the angle into him from round the wicket to tuck off his pads through square leg
a slower ball outside off, Chandimal cuts too early and is beaten
he's blasted this off the front foot through extra cover, it was a length ball outside off and Chandimal did not hold back, swinging his bat extremely hard
this time he gets an inside edge on to the pad and the ball ricochets towards third man
Chandimal dabs the ball on the front foot towards midwicket
Chandimal cuts between point and cover for a single
that is a quick bouncer outside off stump, Chandimal tries to slash it but is beaten
too full outside off, Chandimal walks into a lovely cover drive, placing the ball through the gap and timing it well enough to reach the boundary
Lee pitches on off and finishes around middle, Chandimal turns the ball off his pads through square
Sanga uses the angle into him from round the wicket to nudge towards square
short of a length delivery outside off, Chandimal dabs close on the off side and the batsmen sprint the single
a full ball outside off, dug out on the off side for a single, Sri Lanka reach 250
short of a length angling into the left-hander, Sanga defends towards the bowler
played off the back foot with soft hands behind point
Wade fires the throw in at the bowler's end after Chandimal dabbed a short of a length ball close on the off side, Chandimal would have been safe even if there was a direct hit
played with an open face towards third man
Sangakkara moves across his crease and plays on the leg side
Sangakkara moves towards the line of the ball outside off and steers towards third man
short of a length ball, Sangakkara misses the pull and gets hit on the body, Chandimal begins to run and then turns back
he moves across his crease to clip a full ball off his pads towards the fielder at long leg
Chandimal rises to meet a ball that lifts awkwardly on him and tucks it off his body towards fine leg, I wonder how someone like Suresh Raina would have played that ball
that's much too wide outside off for Sanga to be pulling, he gets beaten
Sangakkara charges Lee and hits him in the air past the fielder at mid-on to the boundary
a low full toss outside off, Sanga drives through cover point
Sangakkara works the ball in front of square
short of a length ball outside off, Sangakkara uses the angle into him to pull between midwicket and mid-on, he didn't time it properly, hit it with the toe of the bat
played off the hips towards square leg for a single
Sangakkara backed away to make room and hit towards the off side, he got an inside edge towards fine leg, Pattinson had overstepped once again, so a free hit coming up
short of a length outside off, Sangakkara hits it hard off the back foot but can't beat the fielder on the cover boundary
short of a length at the body from over the wicket, Chandimal once again copes with the bounce and fends down on the leg side
a full delivery outside off, Sangakkara drives in front of point for a single
a full and straight delivery, Sangakkara drives from the crease but can't beat cover
Sangakkara gives Sri Lanka victory and gets to his half-century with a powerful swing to the deep midwicket boundary, the best of three finals are level at 1-1 with the decider on Thursday
